Package remodel.meta

Class Property

java.lang.Object
remodel.meta.Nominal
remodel.meta.Property
Direct Known Subclasses:
Attribute, Component, Operation, Reference, Variable
public abstract class Property
extends Nominal
Property is the abstract ancestor of named and typed properties. The name and type of a Property are fixed after creation, such that the name may be used to index the Property in its owning Concept. Each Property owned by a Concept is either an Attribute, Component, Reference or Operation. A further kind of Property owned by an Operation is a Variable.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Method Details

    • setConcept

      public void setConcept​(Concept owner)
      Sets the Concept owning this Property. Invoked reciprocally when this Property is added to a Concept.
      Parameters:
      owner - the owning Concept.

    • getConcept

    • getKind

      public java.lang.String getKind()
      Returns the ReMoDeL keyword String describing the this Property-kind. This property is of one of the five kinds: "attribute", "reference", "component", "operation", or "variable".
      Returns:
      the

    • getVariables

      public java.util.List<Variable> getVariables()
      Returns the formal parameters of this Property. Returns an empty list of Variables by default. Redefined in Executable, to return a list of Variable parameters.
      Returns:
      an empty list of parameters.

    • isExecutable

      public boolean isExecutable()
      Reports whether this Property is executable. Only Executable properties (Operations and Rules) are executable. By default, returns false.
      Returns:
      true if this Property is executable.

    • isMultiple

      public boolean isMultiple()
      Reports whether this Property is a collection of things.
      Returns:
      true if the type denotes a ReMoDeL collection.

    • findConcept

      public Concept findConcept​(java.lang.String type) throws SemanticError
      Looks up a Concept by its type in the enclosing Metamodel.
      Parameters:
      type - the type name of the Concept.
      Returns:
      the Concept.
      Throws:
      SemanticError - if no Concept can be found.

    • findProperty

      public Property findProperty​(java.lang.String name) throws SemanticError
      Looks up a Property by its name in the owning Concept.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Property.
      Returns:
      the Property.
      Throws:
      SemanticError - if no Property can be found.
